contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{nihongo|'''Kitakoma'''|北巨摩郡|Kitakoma-gun}} was a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Yamanashi Prefecture|Yamanashi]], [[Japan]]. The district was dissolved on March 15, 2006 when the town of [[Kobuchisawa, Yamanashi|Kobuchisawa]] merged into the city of [[Hokuto, Yamanashi|Hokuto]]. ==Timeline== * 1878: The district was formed out from the former [[Koma District]]. * September 1, 2004: The town of [[Futaba, Yamanashi|Futaba]] merged with the towns of [[Ryūō, Yamanashi|Ryūō]] and [[Shikishima, Yamanashi|Shikishima]], both from [[Nakakoma District, Yamanashi|Nakakoma District]], to form the city of [[Kai, Yamanashi|Kai]]. * November 1, 2004: The towns of [[Hakushū, Yamanashi|Hakushū]], [[Nagasaka, Yamanashi|Nagasaka]], [[Sutama, Yamanashi|Sutama]] and [[Takane, Yamanashi|Takane]] merged with the villages of [[Akeno, Yamanashi|Akeno]], [[Mukawa, Yamanashi|Mukawa]] and [[Ōizumi, Yamanashi|Ōizumi]] to form the city of [[Hokuto, Yamanashi|Hokuto]] * March 15, 2006: The town of Kobuchisawa merged into the city of Hokuto. The district ceased to exist. {{coord missing|Yamanashi Prefecture}} [[Category:Former districts of Yamanashi Prefecture]] {{Yamanashi-geo-stub}}
